titleStmt.title: John H. McHenry et al. to Beriah Magoffin
CWG9847

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Beriah Magoffin: Governor's Official Correspondence File, Petitions for Pardons and Remissions, 1859-1862

body.p: To His Excellency the Govenor of Ky

The undersigned citizens of Daviess county Kentucky, beg leave to represent to your excellency that at the September term of the Daviess Circuit Court a judgment was rendered against David Owen of the county for $7500 on an indictment for "striking with intent to kill in sudden heat" one Albert G Howard They state that the said David Owen is a good and worthy citizen, of the commonwealth an poor but up right and honest man & that in view of his poverty ^previous^ character & good conduct we recommend him as a fit subject for executive clemency and petition for executive clemency, and petition your excellency to remit his fines --

John H, McHenry
Robert, P, Sharp
Thomas Dodson
W T Potterfield
J B Mitchell
James B Cruse
B J Mitchell
John N Sharp
Joseph, T, Silver
Wm J. Johnson
John S Ford
John Locke

Daviess Cir. Ct
$75. } Assault
David Owen
Respd 12 Mos

Remitted
B. M.
Issd Jany 22. 1861
